properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 31 at 7:19PM AKST until January 1 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring along the coast. Visibility
will be near zero at times. Travel will be very difficult to
impossible. Inland areas will have wind chills to 40 below.

* WHERE...Yukon Delta.

* WHEN...Until 3 PM Wednesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 60 mph will cause
whiteout conditions in blowing snow and drifting snow along the
coast. The worse conditions are near Scammon Bay. Cold wind
chills as low as 40 below zero will cause frostbite in as
little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel extremely difficult.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED
